channel.title: Combined Politepol Feed
channel.description: Merged feed from multiple Politepol sources

item.title: US envoy Sergio Gor says India to be invited to join Pax Silica in Feb: What is this tech alliance?
Who will rule Iran if the regime falls?
Timeline: How the Iran protests started and spread nationwide
Why are Google founders saying bye to California, where they made their fortune?
How Pakistan fooled Trump over Gaza by inviting a Hamas commander
NSA Ajit Doval does not use a mobile phone, internet. Here’s why
Iran at the brink: Is the Islamic Republic losing control?
item.description: Internal fissures within the system are reportedly emerging, and internal strife is likely once the prospect of regime change becomes clearer. Democracy, if it comes, is likely to emerge in phases

item.title: Panama and Venezuela, 36 years apart: How Bush and Trump used law to break law
item.description: George HW Bush invaded Panama after CIA agent Manuel Noriega turned against the US, while Donald Trump attacked Venezuela to remove Nicolás Maduro and seize its oil. Both attacks were illegal

item.title: Has UN become obsolete? Why India needs its own sphere of influence
item.description: As great powers retreat from multilateralism and redraw their spheres of influence, the United Nations is no longer shaping the world — it is merely reflecting it

item.title: Pakistan’s Gaza deception: How Gen Munir said yes, meant no, and fooled Trump
item.description: Islamabad’s response to the Gaza peacekeeping proposal reveals a familiar pattern: Say yes to Washington, signal no at home, and let someone else take the blame

item.title: Ukraine to Venezuela: India’s geopolitical strategy amidst global turbulence
item.description: The world has moved from a predictable, albeit tense, Cold War bipolarity to a fluid, contested system defined by rising powers, intertwined economies, technological competition, and challenges to traditional state power

item.title: Power, law and empire: Seismic implications of American military operation in Venezuela
item.description: If the United States, the self-proclaimed defender of international law, can bypass that law, then others will too
